subject: verbal_reasoning

content.text:
Find one word that has two different meanings and can complete both sentences.

The dog began to ___ loudly at the unfamiliar sound.

The rough ___ of the tree was covered in moss.

explanation: 'Bark' can refer to the sound a dog makes or the outer layer of a tree trunk. The other words only fit one sentence.

subject: verbal_reasoning

content.text:
Find one word that has two different meanings and can complete both sentences.

The detective tried to ___ the suspect's lies.

The small boat began to ___ after being hit by a large wave.

explanation: 'Expose' can mean to reveal something hidden, like a lie, or to subject something to an element, like a wave sinking a boat. The other words only fit one sentence.

subject: verbal_reasoning

content.text:
Find one word that has two different meanings and can complete both sentences.

The magician asked the audience to watch his hands very __.

The glass shattered when it hit the ___ edge of the table.

explanation: 'Sharply' can mean carefully or with precision, or it can mean having a cutting edge. The other words only fit one sentence.

subject: verbal_reasoning

content.text:
Find one word that has two different meanings and can complete both sentences.

Be sure to ___ your name at the bottom of the page.

There was a noticeable ___ that the politician used throughout his speech.

explanation: 'Sign' can mean to write one's name or a gesture/symbol. The other words only fit one sentence.

subject: verbal_reasoning

content.text:
Find one word that has two different meanings and can complete both sentences.

After the storm, the dog would not stop its loud ___. 

The tree's rough ___ scraped against my skin.

explanation: 'Bark' refers both to the sound a dog makes and the outer layer of a tree's trunk and branches.

subject: verbal_reasoning

content.text:
Find one word that has two different meanings and can complete both sentences.

The detective needed a ___ to start the fire to burn the evidence.

That tennis ___ was very exciting to watch.

explanation: 'Match' can refer to a small stick used to start a fire, or a sporting contest between two sides.
